hiringPattern.pattern: Focuses heavily on raw problem-solving, algorithmic efficiency, and scalable system design. Usually includes 4-5 technical rounds.

questions.title: Median of Two Sorted Arrays
questions.description: Given two sorted arrays nums1 and nums2 of size m and n respectively, return the median of the two sorted arrays.
questions.expectedOutput: The median value as a float.

questions.title: Longest Increasing Path in a Matrix
questions.description: Given an m x n integers matrix, return the length of the longest increasing path in matrix.

questions.title: Google File System (GFS) Principles
questions.description: Explain how GFS handles component failures and maintains data integrity across thousands of machines.

questions.title: Implement a Thread-Safe LRU Cache
questions.description: Design and implement an LRU cache that can be safely accessed by multiple threads simultaneously.

questions.title: Kth Largest Element in a Stream
questions.description: Design a class to find the kth largest element in a stream. Note that it is the kth largest element in the sorted order, not the kth distinct element.

questions.title: Deadlock Detection in Distributed Systems
questions.description: Describe the Chandy-Misra-Haas algorithm for distributed deadlock detection.

questions.title: Red-Black Tree vs AVL Tree
questions.description: Compare the performance of Red-Black Trees and AVL Trees in terms of lookup, insertion, and deletion operations.

questions.title: String to Integer (atoi)
questions.description: Implement the myAtoi(string s) function, which converts a string to a 32-bit signed integer.

questions.title: Valid Parentheses with Multiple Types
questions.description: Given a string s containing just the characters '(', ')', '{', '}', '[' and ']', determine if the input string is valid.

questions.title: TCP Three-Way Handshake
questions.description: Detail the steps and flags involved in a TCP three-way handshake and explain its importance.
